sections.text: otherwise provided in the Nebraska Uniform Adult Guardianship and Protective Proceedings Jurisdiction Act, the venue for guardianship proceedings for an incapacitated person is in the place where the incapacitated person resides or is present, or where property is located if he or she is a nonresident. If the incapacitated person is admitted to an institution pursuant to order of a court of competent jurisdiction, venue is also in the county in which that court sits.SourceLaws 1974, LB 354, § 236, UPC § 5-302;Laws 2011, LB157, § 36.Cross ReferencesNebraska Uniform Adult Guardianship and Protective Proceedings Jurisdiction Act, see section 30-3901.

30-2618.Venue.

Unless otherwise provided in the Nebraska Uniform Adult Guardianship and Protective Proceedings Jurisdiction Act, the venue for guardianship proceedings for an incapacitated person is in the place where the incapacitated person resides or is present, or where property is located if he or she is a nonresident. If the incapacitated person is admitted to an institution pursuant to order of a court of competent jurisdiction, venue is also in the county in which that court sits.

SourceLaws 1974, LB 354, § 236, UPC § 5-302;Laws 2011, LB157, § 36.

Cross ReferencesNebraska Uniform Adult Guardianship and Protective Proceedings Jurisdiction Act, see section 30-3901.
